resources.string: Click on the image to classify

We have three different applications that we have worked on: Organic classification (Apples, Kiwi, Blueberries), Olive Oil Adulteration, Kiwi Organic Classification. Scroll the wheel and select any of the applications.\nChoose which mode you\'d like to test the application on: Simple mode is for the layman to test (it is also faster to run, patched image), Advanced mode gives users the ability to select their own pixels to be used for Classification (can use the whole image).\nOffline Mode lets the user use pre-existing images to be used in our models, It will also enable the user to test our model on android phones which do not have a NIR camera (by using our own provided images). So pressing it will allow the user to run the app and on the next page will require the user to input two images (RGB and NIR).

Clicking the camera capture button captures both RGB and NIR image, back to back, to make it easy to align the two images.\nThe camera will not capture photo if the lighting conditions are not adequate.

Swipe through the two RGB and NIR images. Tap on any part of the image to get a 128 * 128 bounding box which will be used in the Reconstruction phase.\nIn the simple mode, the application places the box in the middle (the image has to be 128 * 128). Whereas, for Advanced mode, you\'ll have to tap to use a patched image, not tapping anywhere will use the whole image for Spectral Reconstruction.

Swipe through the reconstructed Hypercube bands.
Tap on the "Analysis" button to show the signature at a particular pixel.
While on the "Analysis" page Long Tap on the GraphView to go back to the original page.
Tap anywhere on any pixel to get its signature to be run through the classifier.
Tap and Hold to show a new signature and delete all other persistent signature analysis.
Swipe through the reconstructed Hypercube bands.\nIn the simple mode, the application just checks the signature of the middle pixel.
